site_description: PomBase is a comprehensive database for the fission yeast Schizosaccharomyces pombe, providing structural and functional annotation, literature curation and access to large-scale data sets

front_page_panels.title: McDonald et al., 2017
front_page_panels.content: Contractile ring structure at nanoscale resolution. Image from [eLife 2017;6:e28865](https://elifesciences.org/articles/28865), used under [CC-BY](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/) license terms.

front_page_panels.title: Bestul AJ et al., 2017
front_page_panels.content: Molecular model of fission yeast centrosome assembly determined by superresolution imaging.  Originally published in [JCB](http://jcb.rupress.org/content/216/8/2409).

front_page_panels.title: J-K Kim et al., 2017
front_page_panels.content: Structural Basis for Shelterin Bridge Assembly.  Originally published in [Mol. Cell](http://www.cell.com/molecular-cell/fulltext/S1097-2765%2817%2930809-2).

front_page_panels.title: Murayama Y. et al., 2018
front_page_panels.content: Study shows second ssDNA capture by the SMC complex during establishment of sister chromatid cohesion. Originally published in Cell.

front_page_panels.title: Yukawa M. et al., 2018
front_page_panels.content: Model illustrating collaborative inward force generation by kinesin-14s. Originally published in the Journal of Cell Science.

front_page_panels.title: Thodberg M. et al., 2018
front_page_panels.content: CAGE-defined Transcription Start Sites across 5 different conditions. Pre-publication manuscript ...

front_page_panels.title: Curto M. et al., 2017
front_page_panels.content: The ancient claudin Dni2 facilitates cell fusion at the shmoo tip. Originally published in Cellular and Molecular Life Sciences.

front_page_panels.title: MacKay K. et al., 2018
front_page_panels.content: Graph-based visualization of Hi-C datasets. Originally published in BMC Research Notes.

front_page_panels.title: Allard K. et al., 2018
front_page_panels.content: A unified model for cell size control. Originally published in The Journal of Cell Biology. Image from a Commentry by Gerganova and Martin.

front_page_panels.title: Parua P. et al., 2018
front_page_panels.content: A Cdk9-PP1 switch for RNA polymerase II elongation-termination. Originally published in Nature.

front_page_panels.title: Swaffer M. et al., 2018
front_page_panels.content: Quantitative phosphoproteomics reveals the signaling dynamics of cell-cycle kinases; ~10K phosphorylation sites now in PomBase. Originally published in Cell Reports.

front_page_panels.title: Meadows et al., 2018
front_page_panels.content: Sharpening the anaphase switch. Originally published in Cell Reports.

front_page_panels.title: Tay et al., 2018
front_page_panels.content: Microtubule depolymerization in scd1Δ cells leads to PORTLI growth. Originally published in the Journal of Cell Science.

front_page_panels.title: Sajiki et al., 2018
front_page_panels.content: Essential genes for quiescence to cell cycle switching. Originally published in Science Advances.

front_page_panels.title: Ganguly et al., 2018
front_page_panels.content: Genome-wide phenotypic analysis of chromate toxicity. Originally published in PLoS Genetics.

front_page_panels.title: Bravo Núñez et al., 2018
front_page_panels.content: *wtf* genes in poison–antidote meiotic drive and its suppression. Originally published in PLoS Genetics.

front_page_panels.title: Webster et al., 2019
front_page_panels.content: RNA-binding proteins distinguish between similar sequence motifs to promote targeted deadenylation by Ccr4-Not. Originally published in eLife.

front_page_panels.title: von Loeffelholz et al., 2019
front_page_panels.content: Cryo-EM structure of kinesin-5-microtubule complex reveals a distinct binding footprint and mechanism of drug resistance. Originally published in JMB.

front_page_panels.title: Shukla et al., 2018
front_page_panels.content: Centromere DNA destabilizes H3 nucleosomes to promote CENP-A deposition during the cell cycle. Originally published in Current Biology.

front_page_panels.title: Nakazawa et al., 2019
front_page_panels.content: DNA topoisomerase II phosphorylation in fission yeast reveals anticancer mechanism. Originally published in JBC.

front_page_panels.title: Choi et al., 2019
front_page_panels.content: Zinc transporters belonging to the Cation Diffusion Facilitator (CDF) family have complementary roles in transporting zinc out of the cytosol. Originally published in PLoS Genetics.

front_page_panels.title: Li et al., 2019
front_page_panels.content: Systematic analysis reveals the prevalence and principles of bypassable gene essentiality. Originally published in Nature Communications.

front_page_panels.title: Lu et al., 2018
front_page_panels.content: Swi5-Sfr1 stimulates Rad51 recombinase filament assembly by modulating Rad51 dissociation. Originally published in PNAS.

front_page_panels.title: Cortés et al., 2019
front_page_panels.content: Specific primary septum detection reveals septum and cleavage furrow ingression during early anaphase independent of mitosis completion. Originally published in PLoS Genetics.

front_page_panels.title: Martín-García et al., 2019
front_page_panels.content: Paxillin-mediated recruitment of calcineurin to the contractile ring is required for cytokinesis. Originally published in Cell Reports.

front_page_panels.title: Laboucarié et al., 2017
front_page_panels.content: Taf12 phosphorylation inhibits sexual differentiation downstream of TORC2. Originally published in EMBO reports.

front_page_panels.title: Longmuir et al., 2019
front_page_panels.content: Unexpected insertion of carrier DNA during CRISPR-Cas9, and "unknowns" remain "unknown" Originally published in BMC Research Notes.

front_page_panels.title: Willet et al., 2019
front_page_panels.content: NDR Kinase Sid2 Drives Anillin-like Mid1 from the Membrane to Promote Cytokinesis. Originally published in Current Biology.

front_page_panels.title: Shen et al., 2019
front_page_panels.content: Set7, a histone methyltransferase for the uncharted histone H3-37 mark. Originally published in Structure.

front_page_panels.title: Reid et al., 2018
front_page_panels.content: Fission yeast contains separate CC- and A-adding tRNA nucleotidyltransferases. Originally published in Biochemical and Biophysical Research Communications.

front_page_panels.title: Okada et al., 2019
front_page_panels.content: Distinct roles of myosin-II isoforms in cytokinesis under normal and stressed conditions. Originally published in iScience.

front_page_panels.title: Step into the unknown
front_page_panels.content: Browse PomBase's inventory of conserved proteins with no known biological role

front_page_panels.title: Biological process overview
front_page_panels.content: The fission yeast [GO slim](browse-curation/fission-yeast-go-slim-terms) provides a summary of genes annotated to broad biological processes

front_page_panels.title: Data mining
front_page_panels.content: Use the [Advanced Search](/query) to construct complex queries (GO, phenotypes, taxonomic distribution, domain, chromosomal location).

front_page_panels.title: Over 200,000 curated annotations
front_page_panels.content: PomBase has integrated over 200,000 manually curated gene-specific annotations. See our [Resource Metrics](about/resource-metrics) page for more literature curation progress reports.

front_page_panels.title: Building networks
front_page_panels.content: PomBase uses manually curated Gene Ontology annotation to generate biological process-specific networks, such as the cytokinesis network excerpted above. Currently available networks are linked to the [GO slim](browse-curation/fission-yeast-go-slim-terms) page.

front_page_panels.title: Help!
front_page_panels.content: PomBase provides extensive documentation and answers many questions in the [FAQ](faq). For any information you can't find there, please <app-contact-email [linkName]="'contact the helpdesk'" [subject]="'PomBase question'"></app-contact-email>.

front_page_panels.title: Community curation in Canto
front_page_panels.content: PomBase has pioneered a community curation system that enables researchers to contribute publication-based annotations directly to database curators. To participate, search for the PubMed ID of your paper [in Canto](https://curation.pombase.org/pombe) or <app-contact-email [linkName]="'contact the helpdesk'" [subject]="'PomBase question'"></app-contact-email>.

front_page_panels.title: The naming of parts
front_page_panels.content: 4020 of the 5070 fission yeast protein-coding genes now have assigned standard names. We encourage all authors and reviewers to ensure that gene names are registered prior to publication. Visit our [gene registry page](gene-names) and the [S. pombe gene naming guidelines](gene-names/gene-naming-guidelines) for more information.

front_page_panels.title: Disease gene orthologs
front_page_panels.content: Of the 3526 *S. pombe* with identified human orthologs, over 500 have been implicated in disease. These are manually annotated with terms from a small in-house vocabulary, and can be searched as described in the [disease gene FAQ](faq/how-can-i-find-s.-pombe-genes-associated-human-disease).

front_page_panels.title: Methods and Protocols chapter
front_page_panels.content:
A guide to getting the most from PomBase, and to its curation philosophy and data organization. [Free download](https://link.springer.com/protocol/10.1007/978-1-4939-7737-6_4) thanks to the [Wellcome Trust](https://wellcome.ac.uk/).

[View chapter ...](https://link.springer.com/protocol/10.1007/978-1-4939-7737-6_4)

front_page_panels.title: Browse our inventory of conserved proteins with no known biological role
front_page_panels.content:
Unknown process now down to 696, [conserved unknowns 410](/gene_subset/characterisation_status_conserved_unknown).
Our "Unknowns" manuscript is now available on bioRxiv: [DOI: 10.1101/469569](https://www.biorxiv.org/content/early/2018/11/16/469569).

front_page_panels.title: New disease associations
front_page_panels.content: [Disease associations](/term/DOID:4) are now provided for 907 pombe genes (up from 610), includes new associations derived from MalaCards. This number will increase as work is still in progress...

front_page_panels.title: Browse our inventory of conserved proteins with no known biological role
front_page_panels.content: Our "unknowns" analysis is now published in [Open Biology](https://royalsocietypublishing.org/doi/10.1098/rsob.180241). You can browse the [list of fission yeast unknown proteins](status/priority-unstudied-genes), and use the "Visualise" button to explore the data interactively in QuiLT, the new tool inspired by [Figure 4](https://royalsocietypublishing.org/doi/10.1098/rsob.180241#RSOB180241F4).

front_page_panels.title: GO slim analysis for any gene list
front_page_panels.content: PomBase's advanced search now allows you to retrieve [GO slim](documentation/pombase-go-slim-documentation) annotations for any set of search results. Combine with the "Gene IDs" query option to find GO slim annotations for your own list of genes.

front_page_panels.title: Motif search updated
front_page_panels.content: The PomBase [Protein Motif Search Tool](/motif_search) allows you to search for any user-defined amino acid sequence, supporting exact matches, wildcards, gaps, and ambiguity codes. This search is now fully integrated into PomBase, allowing results to be sent directly to the [advanced search](/query).
